name: Gaurav Singhal
description: Gaurav is a versatile data/social scientist with over 7 years experience architecting solutions, managing projects, and publishing scientific research. He specialises in developing technologies to address complex coordination and information challenges as often found in the humanitarian sector. Formerly the first Lead Data Scientist at the United Nations World Food Programme, he holds masters degrees in Economics and Information Science from the University of Michigan.

name: Dr Laurence E. Day
description: Laurence is a software engineer specialising in functional programming, blockchain technology, the implementation/auditing of smart contracts and financial programming and risk. Formerly a developer in both risk reporting and model analytics at Standard Chartered Bank in Singapore for four years, he holds both a BSc Jt Hons and PhD in mathematics and theoretical computer science from the University of Nottingham, and is currently studying part-time for a Masters degree in Financial Engineering.

name: Nupur Joshi
description: Nupur is a multi-stakeholder strategy and operational transformation consultant who previously worked at McKinsey & Company for five years, managing projects across Europe, the Middle East, Africa and the United States, with specific focus on energy and chemicals clients. Through a short stint at the UN World Food Programme, she became passionate about solving the challenges identified by the Sustainable Development Goals. Nupur holds a BS in Civil Engineering from the India Institute of Technology - Mumbai, an MBA from the Wharton School of Business, and is the former founder and CEO of Anja Muri, a women's shoe startup.
